Name: eIdentification
Description: Service enabling the identification of citizens or organizations. It can be used to access public services provided by public administrations.

Name: ePayment
Description: Service enabling individuals and organisations to purchase goods or services via digital or online modes, without the involvement of physical money exchange. It provides the possibility to perform financial operations using digital payment methods such as, among others, Banking Cards and Point of Sale (PoS) terminals.

Name: Audit
Description: Service enabling inspection and evaluation of the quality of the information processed by information systems, and to determine the conformance to policies, contract commitments, and regulatory requirements.

Name: eArchiving
Description: Service enabling the collection and catalogation of data for the preservation and reuse of information over the long-term.

Name: eDelivery
Description: Service enabling the creation of a network of nodes for secure digital data exchange through safe and interoperable channels.

Name: eQualification
Description: Service enabling citizens, public institutions and private organisations to verify the authenticity of professionals' qualifications on education and employment career.

Name: eTranslation
Description: Service enabling users to translate text excerpts or complete documents in different languages

Name: Data Extraction, Transformation and Loading
Description: Service enabling organisations to gather data from multiple sources, transform them and load them into a single, centralised location.

Name: Data Analytics
Description: Service enabling the management and analysis of data, to drive business processes and improve business outcomes through more effective decision making and enhanced customer experiences.

Name: Delegation of Power
Description: Service enabling the delegation management via digital means, to delegate responsibilities from an individual invested with certain powers to another one, and to track the related delegation acts.

Name: Workflow Management
Description: Service enabling the configuration and automation of business processes composed of both manual and automatic tasks.

Name: Knowledge Management
Description: Service enabling the identification, collection, storage, manipulation and publication / sharing of valuable information (in any form or representation) to promote and enable the value-creation through knowledge.

Name: eNotification
Description: Service enabling the management of business rules to trigger messages addressed to targeted users depending on specific events / conditions.

Name: Digital collaboration
Description: Service enabling internal staff and external stakeholders of public administrations to interact and work together through a digital platform at any point in time.

Name: Waiting list Management
Description: Service enabling the management and optimisation of a waiting list / queue of users that are willing to access to a specific public service. This service enables an effective management of available resources and an effective delivery of public services to their users.

Name: Open Data Management
Description: Service enabling public administrations' data to be exposed and made available in an "open" format and that can be freely used, re-used and shared by anyone for any purpose.

Name: Anonymisation
Description: Service enabling data owners to sanitise datasets to make them considered as anonymous information, namely information which does not relate to an identified or identifiable natural person or to personal data rendered anonymous in such a manner that the data subject is not or no longer identifiable.

Name: eSignature
Description: Service enabling public administrations and businesses accelerate the creation and verification of electronic signatures that are legally valid in all European Member States.

Name: Secure Access Control
Description: Service enabling the definition of user permissions for allowed operations (e.g. view and/or update) on specific resources (e.g. web pages, documents, etc), and the tracking of user operations.(aka: Permission management)

Name: Content Management
Description: Service enabling the secure and efficient management of multimedia objects (e.g. images, audio, video streams) from their creation and distribution inside and/or outside a public organisation.

Name: Log Management
Description: Service enabling the logging and management of online transactions (e.g. online daily payment transactions) registered by information systems owned by public organisations.

Name: eInvoicing
Description:
Service enabling public organisations to issue, transmit and deliver electronic invoice documents in a structured data format to its providers/suppliers, according to European standards

Digital Invoicing enables the issuing, transmission and delivery of electronic invoice documents in a structured data format between a public administration and its providers/suppliers. Digital Invoicing ensures data security and privacy, and automatic and electronic processing of invoices.

Name: Machine Learning
Description: Service enabling the use of machine learning techniques to automate specific tasks or processes.

Name: Natural-Language Processing (NLP)
Description: Service enabling computers understand, interpret and manipulate human language.

Name: eTendering
Description: Service enabling the electronic end-to-end management of the purchasing process and related tasks associated to the acquisition of third-party goods and/or services through digital means and information and communication technologies.

Name: Contact Management
Description: Service enabling the storage and the organisation of contacts of a public administration's user base (both providers and consumers of its public services), and the tracking of the related interactions.

Name: Forms Management
Description: Service enabling the storage, catalogation and indexing/searching of structured and unstructured documents.

Name: Taxpayer (Private Companies) registry management
Description: Service enabling the digital management of taxpayers base registry including private companies' tax data for an effective control of their obligations, credits and transactions, and for related audit purposes.

Name: Taxpayer (Public Administrations) registry management
Description: Service enabling the digital management of taxpayers base registry including Public Administrations' tax data for an effective control of their obligations, credits and transactions, and for related audit purposes.

Name: Taxpayer (Individuals) registry management
Description: Service enabling the digital management of taxpayers base registry including individuals' tax data for an effective control of their obligations, credits and transactions, and for related audit purposes.

Name: Tangible assets (properties) registry management
Description: Service enabling the digital management of properties' registries for an effective control of taxpayers' properties data (e.g., land data, real estate data, etc.).

Name: Tangible assets (mobile assets) registry management
Description: Service enabling the digital management of mobile assets' registries for an effective control of taxpayers' mobile assets data (e.g., vehicles, boats, aircrafts, etc.).

Name: Intangible assets registry management
Description: Service enabling the digital management of intangible assets' registries for an effective control of taxpayers' intangible assets data (e.g., trademarks, patents, data, algorithms, etc.).

Name: Loans and mortgages registry management
Description: Service enabling the digital management of loans and mortgages data for an effective control of taxpayers' loans and mortgages obligations.

Name: Tax professionals and agents registry management
Description: Service enabling the digital management of legally recognized tax professionals and intermediaries.

Name: Fiscal professions and qualifications registry management
Description: Service enabling the digital management of legally recognized fiscal professions and qualifications.

Name: MyTaxes (taxpayer single point of contact)
Description: Service enabling taxpayers to access their personal tax information and self-manage tax payments. This service acts also as information portal, providing clear information about taxpayers obligations in terms of applicable taxes and when and where they are payable enabling taxpayers to understand and pursue their obligations, reducing or avoiding the risk of being detected.

Name: Interests and penalties
Description: Service enabling taxpayers to digitally calculate the amount of interests and penalties due to the tax administration.

Name: Tax returns control
Description: Service enabling the digital discovery of discrepancy between the income data declared in tax self-assessed returns and the income data available in both internal (e.g., income registry) and external (e.g., properties registry) registries managed or accessed by tax administrations. This service usually relies on AI techniques and inference rules.

Name: Confiscated assets registry management
Description: Service enabling the digital management of confiscated assets data for an effective control of all the confiscated assets of taxpayers.

Name: Dispute registry management
Description: Service enabling the digital management of tax litigation data for an effective control of all the current and past tax litigation cases.

Name: Economic activity codes registry management
Description: Service enabling the establishment and management of an economic activities' registry. Economic activities are usually classified using national/international classification taxonomies and each activity type is identified with a specific code/number. (i.e. European NACE). This service supports the economic activity classification management at European, national and local level.

Name: Tax calendar
Description: Service enabling fiscal calendar management to proactively inform taxpayers of fiscal deadlines and to reduce tax avoidance.

Name: Anti-fraud management
Description: Service enabling the digital discovery and detection of tax frauds. This services consumes different business agnostic service enabling business intelligence capabilities.

Name: Internal auditing
Description: Service enabling tax authority to digitally perform the internal auditing controls.

Name: Value Added Tax calculation and payment
Description: Service enabling the digital calculation and payment of VAT.

Name: Property Tax calculation and payment
Description: Service enabling the digital calculation and payment of taxes related to properties (e.g. real estate).

Name: Income Tax calculation and payment
Description: Service enabling the digital calculation and payment of taxes related to personal income.

Name: Excise Tax calculation and payment
Description: Service enabling the digital calculation and payment of excise taxes.

Name: Withholding calculation on compensation
Description: Service enabling the digital calculation of withholding tax on employees' compensation.

Name: Advance Tax ruling
Description: Service enabling tax payers (especially businesses, for complex cases) to digitally be notified in advance a ruling from tax authorities on the amount of taxes to be paid in a future period, i.e. before the actual payment of the taxes. Tax authorities should be bound to the decision of the advance ruling once made. This service allows tax authorities to minimise official complaints and disputes after the taxes are already paid.

Name: Dispute management
Description: Service enabling the digital management and resolution of disputes between taxpayers and tax authorities.

Name: Tax Pre-Audit and Due-Diligence management
Description: Service supporting the digital execution of fiscal due-diligence and pre-auditing activities based on the available taxpayer data.

Name: Environmental Tax calculation and payment
Description: Service enabling the digital calculation and payment of environmental taxes.

Name: Full taxable base discovery
Description: Service enabling the digital discovery of possible base erosions or profit shifting by companies, through the application of transfer pricing rules or special measures for transfers of hard-to-value intangibles (HTVI).

Name: Macro-economic framework
Description: Service enabling the digital collection of information from the ministry of finance enabling the management of a macro-economic framework (provided by legally national institutions and provided by international institutions).

Name: State tax catalog management
Description: Service enabling the digital management of tax types list at state/local level.

Name: European tax catalog management
Description: Service enabling the digital management of tax types list at European level. The service allow to compare and "match/map" tribute types of different MSs.

Name: Cross-border EU claims management
Description: Service enabling intra-European Union claims recovery management supporting the activities performed by a Central Liaison Office.

Name: Third countries claims recovery
Description: Service enabling extra-European Union claims recovery management.

Name: Tributary justice case management
Description: Service enabling the management of tributary justice court cases (workflow of court cases).

Name: Financial flows management
Description: Service enabling the digital management of financial flows transfers from the central tax administration (typically the Ministry of Finance) and national or international "agencies".

Name: Tax claims management
Description: Service enabling the digital management of claims by taxpayers.

Name: Fiscal system management
Description: Service enabling the digital management of the local tax administration in terms of taxes collection and draft local regulation.

Name: Tax history management
Description: Service enabling the management of the evolution of tax rules (tax regulation) along time.

Name: Patrimony/Matrimony analysis
Description: Service enabling analysis and reporting of taxpayers Patrimony.

Name: Revenue tracking and analysis
Description: Service enabling tax authorities to track and analyse information and data related to taxpayers revenue streams.

Name: Heritages and rentings management (Real estate)
Description: Service enabling the digital management of heritages and rentings.

Name: Banking accounts monitoring
Description: Service enabling the digital monitoring of taxpayer's bank accounts for tax calculation purposes.

Name: Workforce allocation
Description: Service enabling tax administration to correctly manage and allocate tax administration personnel.

Name: Cross-border EU tax registry management
Description: Service enabling the digital management of information about the main taxes in force in the EU Member States.

Name: Macro-economic forecasts
Description: Service enabling the digital creation of economic forecasts to better create plan future policies and government actions.

Name: Scenario analysis management
Description: Service enabling the digital creation and analysis of different scenarios related to tax regulation.

Name: Tax Research management
Description: Service enabling the digital consultation of tax related researches in a one-stop go-to source.

Name: Gaming operators registry management
Description: Service enabling the digital management of Gaming operators taxpayers registry including both private and public companies' tax data for an effective control of their obligations, credits and transactions, and for related audit purposes.

Name: Cross-border EU tax management
Description: Service enabling intra-European Union tax information recovery management supporting the reconciliation of data to combat tax fraud, tax avoidance and evasion.

Name: Invoice rules management
Description: Service enabling the digital management of information about the main invoicing rules, VAT refunds and VAT rates in force in the EU Member States.

Name: Special event tax calculation and payment
Description: Service enabling the digital calculation and payment of taxes related to from special events (festivals, fairs, shows etc.).

Name: State monopoly goods registry management
Description: Service enabling the State monopoly goods registry management

Name: State monopoly laboratories management
Description: Service enabling the State monopoly laboratories support

Name: Monopoly goods accreditation/certification
Description: Service enabling the monopoly goods accreditation/certification process support, including chemical/physical analysis of goods managed by state monopoly

Name: Monopoly goods excises/tariffs
Description: Service enabling the monopoly goods excises/tariffs management

Name: International tax agreement support
Description: Service enabling the multilateral tax agreement development and maintenance support

Name: Games, lottery and prize competitions registry management
Description: Service enabling the games & lotteries registry management; includes application and authorisation process support

Name: Games, lottery and prize competitions tariffs
Description: Service enabling games, lotteries and prize competition registry management

Name: Monopoly goods tax calculation and payment
Description: Service enabling monopoly goods tax calculation and payment

Name: Games, lotteries, and prize competitions tax calculation and payment
Description: Service enabling games, lotteries and prize competition tax calculation and payment

Name: Special event registry management
Description: Service enabling special events registry management. (Limited in time and spaces events... Olympic Games, World Exhibitions etc. Diplomats…)

Name: Economic Operators Registry management
Description: Service enabling unique benefits to all economic operators and their business partners involved in the international supply chain.

Name: Tariff Registry management
Description: Service enabling the incorporation of all measures relating to tariffs, trade measures, EU rural policy and the measures imposed by the National Customs Legislation. It also includes prohibitions, restrictions, and measures that help gather statistics, such as surveillance of imports and exports.

Name: Origin Registry management
Description: Service enabling the certification of origin of goods based on a principle of self-certification. Economic operators themselves declare the origin of goods by means of so-called statements on origin. To be entitled to make out a statement on origin, an economic operator has to be registered in a database by his competent authorities. The economic operator becomes a "registered exporter".

Name: Customs declarations
Description: Service enabling the editing of official documents that list and give details of goods that are being imported or exported. The Customs declarations system will allow goods to be placed under a customs procedure using centralised clearance, allowing economic operators to centralise their business from a customs viewpoint. The processing of the customs declaration and the physical release of the goods should be coordinated between the related customs offices. It concerns a trans-European system containing components developed centrally and nationally.

Name: Intra-EU purchases and sales
Description: Service enabling the appropriate management of purchase and sale actions between the European Union and foreign countries. The system allows the custom authorities to manage the data coming from international purchases and sales while in addition it collects indirect information and performs data analysis.

Name: EU Custom Trader Portal
Description: Service enabling access to the online systems for "Authorised Economic Operators" as well as "European Binding Tariff Information". This system aims to harmonise access to the different EU customs systems; it is expected that all other EU customs systems will be connected to this portal.

Name: Applications and Requests
Description: Service enabling the appropriate management of all the documents and procedures that are necessary to be performed to provide to private and public companies the ability to export or import goods and services.

Name: Customs Decisions system
Description: Service enabling the management and processing of applications and decisions with a Union-wide validity. The authorisations, when granted, will provide Economic Operators with simplifications to conduct their business across the EU. Together with the EU Trader Portal, it offers an appropriate level playing field among all economic operators in the EU, big and small, and make sure that EU businesses remain competitive to withstand globalisation. Customs Decisions System will also support the Member States' customs authorities in the proper management of applications and decisions and in the protection of financial interests as it enables automated checks in the declaration systems.

Name: Procedure Automation System
Description: Service enabling the support of import, export, transit and special procedure automation.

Name: Notification of Arrival, Presentation Notification and Temporary Storage
Description: Service enabling the notification of Arrival of the means of transport, presentation of the goods (Presentation Notification) and declaration for temporary storage, and to support harmonisation in this respect across the Member States as regards the data exchange between trade and customs.

Name: Analysis management
Description: Service enabling the coordination of all the activities relating to the laboratory workflow management. It also supports the quality classification of goods (to determine the tariff potentially) and the authenticity of products.

Name: Compliance verification management
Description: Service enabling custom professionals to define and execute a variety of controls and checks to appropriately handle goods analysis, verification and validation activities.

Name: Preservation of cargo control
Description: Service enabling the controlling and monitoring of the cargo handling operations. This service includes procedures such as loading and unloading, pump control, heating control and monitoring of the cargo conditions and cargo-handling equipment.

Name: Customs organizational structure management
Description: Service enabling the exchange of information and promotes interactions and expertise between custom departments.

Name: EU Customs information exchange
Description: Service enabling the accurate and timely share of meaningful information among customs from different member states.

Name: (Internal) Customs' logistics management
Description: Service that is responsible for all the activities that are related to customs internal logistic procedures. Usually, this service consumes the Preservation of cargo control management and the Goods flow analysis and simulation services

Name: Duties calculation and payment
Description: Service that executes the calculation of duties and facilitates their payment through digital means.

Name: Duties guarantee management
Description: Service enabling the appropriate handling of all the processes that are related to the proper management of the agreements that cover debts arising from customs duty, import VAT and excise.

Name: Partner authorization
Description: Service enabling the management of all the procedures that are necessary for the people and businesses that are considered custom-partners. This service is facilitated to reinforce the safety of the import and export of goods and services.

Name: Goods flow analysis and simulations
Description: Service enabling the use of data analysis techniques and innovative technologies to conduct research on goods for risk control purposes.

Name: Computerised Transit
Description: Service enabling the transportation of goods within customs territory (EU) or between the customs territories of different contracting parties (Common Transit). Using the Common Transit procedure means that customs clearance formalities applicable at import are temporarily suspended at the point of entry into the customs territory. Duties, taxes, and commercial policy measures are only applied when the goods reach their destination.

Name: Centralised Clearance for Import
Description: Service enabling Economic Operators with an AEO status to declare goods on one Member State (supervising Member State) while the goods are imported or exported in a different Member State. It also allows centralising the accounting and payment of Customs Duties for all customs transactions in the supervising Member State. This centralisation brings savings in administrative and transaction costs for companies

Name: Classification of  goods
Description: Service enabling the classification of a specific product based on information. When goods are declared to customs in the European Union, they must be classified according to the Combined Nomenclature or any other nomenclature, which is wholly or partly based on the Combined Nomenclature. Imported and exported goods have to be declared under which subheading or further subdivision of the Combined Nomenclature or these other nomenclatures they fall. This determines which rate of customs duty of the Common Customs Tariff or which non-tariff measures apply.

Name: Tariff Suspensions
Description: Service enabling the total or partial waiver of the typical duties granted by the EU. A suspension can be granted for raw materials, semi-finished goods and components used for industrial production if they are not available within the EU. If the goods mentioned above are available within the Union, but there is not enough of them, an autonomous tariff quota can be granted for the missing quantity.

Name: Procedures registry management
Description: Service enabling the management of the type of procedure in force in the Customs domain, including import, export and special procedure.

Name: Laboratories registry management
Description: Service enabling the management of the data about laboratories.

Name: Determination of the economic value of goods declared for importation.
Description: Service enabling the determination of the economic value of goods declared for importation. Together with origin and classification, the customs value provides the basis for assessing the customs debt, which is usually calculated as a percentage of the customs value. The primary valuation method is the transaction value method, which comprises the total amount paid (or to be paid) for the imported goods, but also other methods are considered.

Name: Risk analysis
Description: Service enabling the mitigation of potential threads from fraudulent actions by collecting and analysing data and findings.

Name: Economic Operator management and accreditation
Description: Service enabling the creation, assignment and storage of EORI number for private businesses pre-approved.

Name: Electronic Healthcare Records
Description: Electronic Healthcare Records (HHR) or Electronic Medical Records (EMR) is the service enabling the recording of medical events related to a patient through the entire patient journey. Electronic Medical Records (EMRs) are the digital equivalent of paper records, or charts at a clinician’s office. EMRs typically contain general information, such as treatments and medical history of a patient as it is collected by the individual medical practice and care outcomes.

Name: Health remote sensing and continuous monitoring
Description: Service enabling  remote patient monitoring (RPM) inside and outside of conventional clinical settings through innovative technologies as Artificial Intelligence and Health IoT devices.

Name: Tele-consultation
Description: Service enabling the remote interactions between a clinician and a patient for the purpose of providing a diagnostic or therapeutic advice through electronic means.

Name: Tele-diagnosis
Description: The provision of diagnosis service, through the use of ICT, in situations where the health professional and the patient (or two health professionals) are not in the same location. It involves secure transmission of medical data and information, through text, sound, images or other forms needed for diagnosis.

Name: Drugs/medicines
Description: Service enabling health professionals and health control agencies to manage the registries of drugs and medicines which can be prescribed to patients.

Name: Medical devices/equipments
Description: Service enabling health professionals and health control agencies to manage the registries of medical devices which can be prescribed to patients and medical equipment can be used for patients treatment or examination.

Name: ePrescription
Description: Service enabling the electronic composition and submission of accurate, error-free and understandable prescriptions directly to a pharmacy from the physicians and point-of-care.

Name: eDispensation
Description: Service enabling the electronic retrieval of a prescription and reporting on giving the medicine to the patient as indicated in the corresponding ePrescription.

Name: Consulting network
Description: Service enabling healthcare personnel to exchange information, experiences and mutually discuss specific healthcare topics. It aims to tackle complex or rare diseases and conditions that require highly specialised treatment and a concentration of knowledge and resources (e.g. European Health Reference Network).

Name: Patient digital twin
Description: Service enabling the delivery of personalised medicines through the use of digital copies of patient body to simulate the effect of drugs, medicines and other medical products.

Name: Medical imaging
Description: Service enabling the digital exchange of medical images and reports for clinical analysis and medical intervention, as well as visual representation of the function of some organs or tissues.

Name: Health professionals and skills
Description: Service enabling health institutions to manage the registries of health professions and the skills attributed to a specific health professional.

Name: Laboratory
Description: Service enabling the remote booking of laboratory exams, delivering  digital results and automatic enrichment of the patient Electronic Medical Records (EMRs).

Name: Hospital enterprise resource management
Description: Service enabling the effective and digital management of hospital resources. Those resources can be intangible – people and time – and tangible – equipment, materials, and finances.

Name: Surgical intervention theatre management
Description: Service enabling the management and monitoring of the operating theatre of hospitals  through digital means.

Name: Secondary use of healthcare data
Description: Service enabling healthcare data reuse. The service collects and aggregates healthcare data, applies semantic and cleaning rules, and provides correlated and aggregated data in open forms and formats, according to European and National legislations.

Name: Health service performance management
Description: Service enabling health service processes performance management.

Name: Digital health certificates
Description: Service supporting the lifecycle of digital health certificates. I.e. vaccination certificates (COVID-19 certificates will require vaccination dates/drug/dosage, recovery date, or tests results)

Name: Social/population statistical studies
Description: Service enabling (access to) statistical studies on population related to healthcare

Name: Treatments management
Description: Service enabling the management of the base registry of legally permitted treatments.

Name: Patient summary
Description: Service enabling the management of patient summaries base registry at national level.

Name: Integrated care pathways management
Description:
Service enabling management of integrated care pathways.
Integrated care pathways are structured multidisciplinary care plans which detail essential steps in the care of patients with a specific clinical problem. They have been proposed as a way of encouraging the translation of national guidelines into local protocols and their subsequent application to clinical practice

Name: Explanations and Interaction
Description: Service enabling interactions between patient and caring staff (physicians, nurses, etc.) able to provide answers to "usual/frequent" patient questions about her/his caring path and/or treatments. It is an interactive information system reducing pressure on caregivers and rising the patient satisfaction.

Name: Dependency caregivers management
Description: Service enabling management of caregivers or patient relatives people performing some kind of action to support/improve patient health.

Name: Care service performance management
Description: Service enabling care service processes performance management.

Name: Healthcare enterprise resource management
Description: Service enabling healthcare system resource management.

Name: Learning platform
Description: Service enabling production and submission of training to physicians, nurses and other healthcare people

Name: Health regulation management
Description: Service enabling production and analysis of healthcare related regulation

Name: Medicines and medical devices logistic restrictions
Description: Service enabling management of restriction rules for distribution of medicines and medical devices

Name: Medical apps
Description: Service enabling health professionals and health control agencies to manage the registries of medical applications.

Name: Health-related research programmes
Description: Service enabling management of health-related research programmes and projects

Name: EU research programmes application
Description: Service enabling applications to EU research programmes and projects

Name: Population health assessments
Description: Service enabling data collection on population health (interviewes, screening, trials etc.)

Name: Population health monitoring and surveillance
Description: Service enabling population health monitoring and diseases surveillance

Name: Population health diagnosis
Description: Service enabling diagnosis of pandemic, malnutrition, health disordres and other phenomena affecting the health status of a population

Name: Population health communication
Description: Service enabling the management of communication initiatives to prevent dangerous situations or inform the population about health related risks

Name: Social contact tracing
Description: Service enabling social contact tracing and notification

Name: Vaccination programmes management
Description: Service enabling oragnization and delivery of large vaccination programmes

Name: Prevention programmes management
Description: Service enabling oragnization and delivery of large prevention programmes

Name: Access obstacles identification
Description: Service enabling the identification of intangible, social or physical barriers to the access to cares or treatments.

Name: Local resource allocation
Description: Service enabling resource budget allocation and monitoring based on territorial distribution of healthcare system services, population or other territorial allocation rule.

Name: Health sector resource allocation
Description: Service enabling resource budget allocation and monitoring based on healthcare sector and usage of health services. It includes also the Health workers remuneration which is the service enabling resource budget allocation and setting of rules for health facilities renovation, restoration and maintenance.

Name: Facility management resource allocation
Description: Service enabling resource budget allocation and setting of rules for health facilities renovation, restoration and maintenance.

Name: Medical equipment resource allocation
Description: Service enabling resource budget allocation and setting of rules for medical equipment renovation, restoration and maintenance.

Name: Treatment payments management
Description: Service enabling patients to -directly or indirectly- pay health services and treatments. This service allows direct payments using the "business agnostic" payment gateway service, and indirect payments supporting information exchanges with insurance companies, social security institutions, etc.

Name: Treatment outcomes management
Description: Service enabling quantitative and qualitative evaluation of treatments/health-service "effectiveness". This service supports; (a) patients to express evaluations and access to statistical data about the relationship between treatment/health-service rates and health outcomes; and (b) quantitative analysis on effectiveness of healthcare workers activities and treatments effects to maintain/restore the health status of patients and population.

Name: Outcome-based rates/remuneration settings
Description: Service enabling the treatment/health-service rates settings based on quantitative outcomes.
